if you are getting slow dl speeds then make sure to play with your upload speed, I was uploading at 50 kb/s and downloading at 240, I increased the uploading to 80 - got 300 download. Increased the upload to 100 and got less than 200 download, but then I increased the upload to 90 kb/s and I actually got 330kb/s - while my max with the best connection is 340 maybe 350kb/s.

so... increase your upload speed, it helps sometimes!

Also - Options> Preferences > Bandwidth

Make sure the "number of connections" in each field is 500 - you will connect to more people and get better speeds as well.

For people having trouble with the game just returning to the launcher on startup, or with missing or invisible text.  These are also a couple of the bugs that are known to affect some people with the retail boxed and digital download versions of the game so it isn't the cracked versions here that are at fault.  The missing text is a compatibility problem with the Nvidia drivers apparently.  Turn off the 3D vision drivers and if this doesn't work try the new beta drivers from the Nvidia website.  The launcher problem has not got a single fix yet although some have managed to get around it.  For everyone else we just have to do what those who bought the box are doing and wait for the patch to arrive.

So, i downloaded the entire game, followed the instructions to the last letter, got the game up and running, but when im in game the colors arern't working correctly, it almost looks like its a grahpic card issue, but its a fairly new card, im using a Raedon HD 6850, it wont play in fullscreen, and seems to have a very slow boot time. (starts up about 30 seconds after i click the logo)  running a I5 chip @ 3.2 GHZ, 8 GB of Ram, so its not a tech problem, anybody having any similar issues, the colors are so outrageous that it literally makes the game implayable.
if you get launcher issues try lowering your desktop resolution changed mine from 2048x1152 to 1900x1080 game now works

Update - Got the game working perfectly, had to turn off the Anti-Aliasing, for some reason its not working for the game on ATI cards.  this is done by right clicking on your desktop, click Catalyst Controll Panel, then Gaming, and click the checkbox of "use application settings" and take the scroll bar all the way left.  anyway, was the perfect fix for me, if anybody else is having this problem, try this solution out.

How to install.

Extract the files in DVD1 and DVD2
Mount/Burn the iso in DVD1
Install(Quit activation screen)
Mount/burn the iso in DVD2
Run the Patcher_EFIGS.exe in the SKIDROW folder
Copy all the files in SKIDROW to where you installed the game.

I followed these instructions from OrangePillow at 2011-05-18 02:59 CET:

STEPS:

1. Installed the game, after it was done a window popped up. Closed it by clicking the cross in the upper right corner.

2. Started the Game/Launcher, waited till the update was finished.

3. After the update the same window from before popped up but this time I clicked accept in the bottom right corner.

4. Started the Game/Launcher to see what message I would get. An activation screen popped up in which you could insert information etc.

5. Well that's not good so then I copied the cracked paul.dll to the bin folder in the witcher 2 directory which replaced the existing one.

6. Started the Game/Launcher and what do you know, it worked and my fun time could start.

*It works and no virus.  Thanks
